title: Lizzy Caplan is flawless for fall in claret-colored coat and trousers as she promotes Castle Rock
text:
She stars in the second season of Hulu's Castle Rock.

And on Tuesday, ahead of the show's debut on Wednesday, Lizzy Caplan continued her publicity tour for the series in New York.

The actress, 37, was snapped arriving at Build Studio in the Big Apple in a flawless fall ensemble of a claret colored coat and matching trousers.

Promotion: She stars in the second season of Hulu's Castle Rock. And ahead of the show's debut on Wednesday, Lizzy Caplan continued her publicity tour for the series in New York

Caplan's tailored coat was sleeveless, had wide lapels and fell to below her knees.

Underneath it she wore a long-sleeve white shirt and she had a patterned silk scarf around her neck.

Her wide-leg trousers fell long enough to cover her shoes as she walked.

The actress wore her shoulder-length brunette locks loose and styled with a center parting.

Looking good: The actress, 37, wore a flawless fall ensemble of a claret colored coat and matching wide-leg trousers

Stylish: Caplan's tailored coat was sleeveless, had wide lapels and fell to below her knees. Underneath it she wore a long-sleeve white shirt and had a patterned scarf around her neck

Castle Rock is based on stories and characters created by Stephen King.

In the second season, Caplan stars as Misery character Annie Wilkes in the years before the events of the novel which was adapted into a 1990 film starring Kathy Bates.

Caplan admitted in an interview with Variety that it had been daunting to take on a character which had already been fleshed out on the page and on the big screen.

'I wasn’t sure how much I wanted to incorporate what I loved about Kathy Bates’ performance into my own performance, but if you break up Annie Wilkes’ life into three parts, there’s her childhood, there’s the bulk of what our story is about, and then there’s what you see of her in the film,' she explained. 'I wanted to have our Annie feasibly be able to become that Annie in the future.'

Prequel: In the show based on stories and characters created by Stephen King, Caplan stars as Misery character Annie Wilkes who arrives in Castle Rock with her teen daughter Joy

In Castle Rock, Annie has a teen daughter Joy, played by Elsie Fisher, and becomes stranded in the town after crashing her car.

'When she was young, her complete obsession was her father; for the majority of our season her total obsession is her daughter; and then we know the book and the film, her obsession is Misery and Paul Sheldon,' Caplan said of Annie in her Variety interview.

'She is somebody who needs to hook into a singular obsession to move forward in her life, unfortunately for other people.'

Caplan's previous credits include Freaks and Geeks, Mean Girls, New Girl and Masters of Sex.
